Judul: EFFECT OF INLET VELOCITY VARIATION AND INLET-OUTLET AIR EXTENSION ON THE CHARACTERISTICS OF AIRFLOW IN THE OPERATING ROOM
Abstrak:
Surgery room is specifically made to meet the needs of invasive procedure that
doctor performs on the patient. It requires a good heating,ventilation, and air
conditioning system that abides standards made by various organization. Most
existing standards used easily identifiable parameters, such as temperatureand
humidity, while air velocity distribution and airflow patterns are seldom discussed.
This research aims to make a model of a surgery room and numerically solving it
to see the air flow pattern, velocity and temperature distribution. Simulation is
done with COMSOL software.
The surgery room model is a shallow truncated square room with dimension close
to 7x7 m2. Simulations are done to see effects of inlet air parameter
variation,which ranges from 0.15 m/s to 0.6 m/s, with temperature variation
ranges from 22 to 27 °C. Another variation will be the addition of air outlets on
the ceiling, addition of heat source in the form of surgery lamp, and the addition
of air curtain system.
From the simulation and analysis, it can be concluded that inlet parameter have
little to no effect to the airflow and air velocity. It can also be concluded that the
temperature distribution in the room spread more evenly as the air inlet velocity
increase. Beside that, it can be concluded that the addition of outlet on the ceiling
increase the number of vortices in the room, and make the velocity more evenly
distributed. The addition of surgical lamp lessens the vortices around them but
raised the air temperature significantly. Addition of air curtain change the air
velocity distribution greatly, but decrease the level of vortices all around the room.
